thread.title: Blocks building up the outer rim
thread.title_full: Blocks building up the outer rim

author: Sophie Foster
title: Blocks building up the outer rim
text:
ALVIN and Nitasha Bhan were among the first to put their hands up when blocks in a neighbouring development site came on the market – they’d had their eyes on it for years.
The Bridgeman Downs couple and their children Aston, 3, and Neera, 1, live just metres away from Mirvac’s new Bridgeman Downs residential development – an area Mr Bhan said was “very quickly emerging as a real well-to-do suburb”.
“The premium blocks were first to go off the market, which was a very strong indication that people are willing to spend in the right area,” he said.
“The block we are on now was $260,000 in 2006, then a house on top of that of around $300,000 and now the value in last six years has gone through the roof. So we’re looking to build a house on this new block while retaining the current property. We also purchased a property in Mango Hill where we’ve finished building six months ago.”
Mr Bhan said the “game plan” was to create a portfolio of properties that covered the spectrum of what was on offer in greater Brisbane, and with house rents in the area hovering around $650 a week, he was more than happy.
Mirvac residential development chief executive John Carfi said lifestyle was huge drawcard in properties that sat on Brisbane’s outer rim.
“You can live in a peaceful pocket of outer Brisbane yet have all the amenities you need right on your doorstep. In Brisbane you can go from CBD to natural bush land in less than 30 minutes and Bridgeman Downs lies on the border of both.”
Originally published as Family quick to snap up site
